Deodorizing: Microwaves can be used to deodorize small spaces. Fill a microwave-safe bowl with water, add a few drops of your preferred essential oil, and heat the mixture for a few minutes. The heat will cause the oils to evaporate, leaving a fresh scent in the room.

Seed Germination: Microwaves can be used to speed up the germination process of seeds. Place the seeds in a microwave-safe container with a small amount of water, cover the container, and heat the mixture for a few minutes. The heat will help to soften the seeds, making it easier for them to germinate.

Cooking Rice: Microwaves can be used to cook rice quickly and easily. Place the rice in a microwave-safe bowl, add the appropriate amount of water, and heat the mixture for a few minutes. The heat will cook the rice, and the steam will help to soften the rice.

Defrosting: Microwaves can be used to quickly and safely defrost frozen foods. Place the frozen food in a microwave-safe container, and heat the food on the defrost setting for a few minutes. The heat will cause the ice to melt, and the food will be ready to eat.

Heating Food: Microwaves can be used to heat up leftovers or cold food. Place the food in a microwave-safe container, and heat the food for a few minutes. The heat will cause the food to warm up, and it will be ready to eat.
